p: The S protein is divided into an S1 domain and an S2 domain, which are responsible for receptor binding and cell membrane fusion, respectively [ 3, 5- 6]. The S1 domain is what contains the RBD, which has specific receptor affinity. In prior coronavirus outbreaks, SARS-CoV-1 targeted the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor, whereas MERS-CoV utilized the dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) receptor [ 2, 9- 10]. When comparing SARS-CoV-1 with MERS-CoV, major differences in their RBDs account for their different receptor specificities [ 2]. Similarly, SARS-CoV-2 also targets ACE2 receptors on human respiratory epithelial cells, suggesting a similar RBD structure to SARS-CoV-1 [ 5, 11]. The pathogenesis is outlined in Figure 1.
